messages: f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e (23:05): Hey folks! Is there any easy way to set expire headers for resources (CSS, JS, IMG) if the apache module mod_expires is not available?
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (23:07): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: ui is configurable to get only 3 bars on top. location bar + tab bar + os window decoration bar
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (23:07): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: +1 if they remove the os window decoration bar
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:11): f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e: you usually set them in your static web server
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:11): f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e: which in this case would be apache, right?
f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e (23:11): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf, yes but the mod_expires module is disabled.
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:12): f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e: then you are out of luck, I guess
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:12): move to a better hosting
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (23:13): moo: what about an .htaccess?

f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e (23:17): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf what about the answer here? would that work? http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3626036/add-expires-header-without-mod-expires
f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e (23:17): header expire with an absolute date combined with max-age?
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:18): I'd still move to better hosting, instead of resorting hacks :) that will bite your ass again on some day
f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e (23:21): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf, k so, what would be a good reason to disable or not enable mod_expires? I think my hoster does this on purpose.
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:23): f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e: good reasons: they want more money out of you
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:23): f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e: bad reasons: no bad reasons
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:23): that's just stupid
1406f0643d5353f7e98b641162a4d4ee (23:24): this book any good? http://www.amazon.com/Introducing-HTML5-Voices-That-Matter/dp/0321687299/ref=sr_1_5?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1301602819&sr=1-5
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:25): it's a good one for a general go-over
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:25): it's not an instructional book
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:26): and i find the authors definitely reputable
1406f0643d5353f7e98b641162a4d4ee (23:28): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: thanks for sharing your thoughts. Would it be suitable for someone starting from *close to* scratch?
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (23:28): i like that book, 1406f0643d5353f7e98b641162a4d4ee
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (23:28): of course i'm biased as one of the authors is my cow orker
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (23:28): it's pretty basic, yes
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:28): you have a mancrush on bruce, 7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b ?
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (23:29): who doesn't?!
1406f0643d5353f7e98b641162a4d4ee (23:29): heh, great. I'll get it.
1406f0643d5353f7e98b641162a4d4ee (23:29): now if someone can spare me the trouble of going into #css and asking for an awesome book on CSS3.
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:29): 3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298: i'm talking about the url bubble that appears at the bottom, that ff4 took from chrome
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:30): 3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298: fyi. i reduced it to less than that: http:/ 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6.org/~glenn/nothingfox.jpg
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:30): http://www.abookapart.com/products/css3-for-web-designers
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (23:31): i've got a never-read copy of handcrafted css if you want it
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:31): blames 7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b's mancrush on the nude pics that bruce and remy did for whatever reason
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:32): vertical tabs work much better than horizontal tabs, especially on large widescreen windows
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (23:32): haha
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (23:33): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: interesting point. true that most webpage dont use the whole width
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:33): personally, i liked bruce's parts more than remy's in that book, but that's cause i care about semantics and markup more than the functionality stuff
1406f0643d5353f7e98b641162a4d4ee (23:33): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 can't find it on amazon (looking for reviews) is it awesome?
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:33): you can't order directly from the lik i pasted 1406f0643d5353f7e98b641162a4d4ee ?
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (23:33): cederholm is a good author
1406f0643d5353f7e98b641162a4d4ee (23:33): 7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b I appreciate it, but shipping would probably cost many times the book's worth, thanks.

0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:34): order the pdf copy
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:34): get it instantly
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (23:34): ah, you're right
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:34): http://www.css3.info/css3-for-web-designers-a-new-book-from-dan-cederholm-and-a-book-apart/
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:34): http://mondaybynoon.com/2010/11/28/css3-for-web-designers/

06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:35): http:/ 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6.org/~glenn/url.jpg made urls show up like that ... the styling isn't optimal and there are some bugs but it's a lot better than having a box constantly flickering in the corner of the screen
1406f0643d5353f7e98b641162a4d4ee (23:35): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 ah, great. Thanks, I should have done that myself.
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:36): most things somehow associated with stuff run by zeldman = quality
1406f0643d5353f7e98b641162a4d4ee (23:36): ah, I wasn't aware. New to the industry.
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:38): welcome to it
1406f0643d5353f7e98b641162a4d4ee (23:39): meant web development
1406f0643d5353f7e98b641162a4d4ee (23:39): I'm a networking guy
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:39): someone needs to take a stand and spec which keys browsers must reserve for web apps
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:39): the hotkey situation is dire with no solution in sight :|
f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e (23:42): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf, why would Firefox still send a request header for resources with an Expires header of "Wed, 01 Jan 2020 00:00:00 GMT"?
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:44): f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e: http://code.google.com/speed/page-speed/docs/caching.html
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:45): it should not
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:45): or it is trying to get HTTP 302 Not Modied answer
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:45): nto sure

f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e (23:46): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf, yes the response is 304 not modified. but i thought if i set an expires header, firefox would NOT send a request until the expires date?
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:46): you might need to set Last Modified as well for HTML content
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:47): there were certain rules for it
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:47): let me dig it up
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:47): what type of fetch is it?
f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e (23:47): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf, I send the headers for CSS/files.
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:47): the details are finicky so I don't remember them all off the top of my head
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:48): f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e: it definitely does not load CSS and JS if I set the expire header
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:48): just expire header

06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:48): i usually tend to see Expires, Last-Modified, Cache-Control: max-age, sometimes Etag ... don't know precisely which are needed by spec and which are legacy compat
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:48): f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e: how are you testing?
f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e (23:49): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf, network tab in firebug.
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:49): ok
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:49): so 1. you have html page open
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:49): 2. you hit enter on address bar
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:49): right?
f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e (23:51): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf, lemme recheck that. :>
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:52): why is firefox wasting space in every request with a DNT header that everyone will ignore? heh
f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e (23:53): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf, it shows all resources, but grayed out - in the network tab.
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:53): it's enabled by default (apparently), so it's not an opt-out, either--so I can't see why anyone would ever respect it
5fc0026b9f7f777f116972a54a446b5b (23:54): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: it's not enabled by default
5fc0026b9f7f777f116972a54a446b5b (23:54): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: and some people start following it
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:54): it's enabled for me, and I don't even know where it's enabled
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:55): it's a header saying "don't do evil things", which seems to me like a no-op ("if they have to be told...")
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:56): puts a "Do Not Steal" sticker on his wallet :P
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (23:56): it seems to be auditable from outside, aka if you claims to follow it, you can be spoted not doing it
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:57): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: I think in the future it is possible that some countries may have legal implications for this
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:57): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: or already have and DNT can be considered the same as putting a sticker in mailbox "no advertisement"
5fc0026b9f7f777f116972a54a446b5b (23:57): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: http://blog.mozilla.com/blog/2011/03/30/advertisers-and-publishers-adopt-and-implement-do-not-track/
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:58): doesn't help much when people are sending you ads from nigeria
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (23:58): 5fc0026b9f7f777f116972a54a446b5b: is there a tool to audit they actually do what they claim ? or a plan to do it ? seems like a good idea no ?
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (23:59): could even be a firefox extension doing that in the background :)
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:59): if it was possible to reliably detect whether someone's tracking you if they don't want you to know, tracking would be a smaller problem
5fc0026b9f7f777f116972a54a446b5b (00:00): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: and you can find the option in Advanced -> General
f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e (00:01): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf, ill give up on that for now. maybe ill have a look later. thx for now.
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:01): "Tell web sites I do not want to be tracked" is unchecked, but DNT is being sent, FYI
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:01): (also I was looking for it in Privacy, which seems the logical place for it)
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (00:03): f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e: ok
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (00:03): I'll be here all the weekend :)

4ca1d7017765e54411ae8e24764d7ac1 (00:03): Hello i have just validate my site via w3c ... it says:The Content-Language state is obsolete. "Consider specifying the language on the root element instead. <meta http-equiv="Content-Language" content="de-DE" />" this means i can remove this completely?
5fc0026b9f7f777f116972a54a446b5b (00:04): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: well, there is a bug then

06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:04): a validator saying something is obsolete doesn't *necessarily* mean you can remove it with zero repercussions--you need to know why it was there to begin with, and whether that reason still applies
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:05): i put the language attribute on the html tag lately

06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:05): 5fc0026b9f7f777f116972a54a446b5b: seems like a potentially significant bug--if it's intended as a legal notification, it being sent by browsers by default due to a bug may become a loophole
5fc0026b9f7f777f116972a54a446b5b (00:05): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: can you check in about:config, look for "track", and give me the value
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:05): i'll re-test without extensions and check the tracker if it still happens
5fc0026b9f7f777f116972a54a446b5b (00:05): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: do you use Adblock Plus?
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:05): p.donottrackheader.enabled is false, and the pref isn't locked
5fc0026b9f7f777f116972a54a446b5b (00:05): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: adblock plus force DNT iirc
5fc0026b9f7f777f116972a54a446b5b (00:06): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: ok, that's the problem, it's adblock plus, not firefox
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:06): ... making it ignore the pref instead of changing the default? that's seriously evil
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:07): i'll file over with them, then
